sentences.en: ...the jargon that frequently obscures educational writing.
sentences.cn: …常使教学行文变得复杂难懂的术语。

sentences.en: an obscure poet
sentences.cn: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.en: For some obscure reason, the group is very popular.
sentences.cn: 这个组合莫名其妙地很受欢迎。

sentences.en: His reasons remain obscure.
sentences.cn: 他的理由不清楚.

sentences.en: His writing is so diffuse and obscure that it is difficult to make out what it is he is trying to say.
sentences.cn: 他的文章含混晦涩，让人看后不知所云。

sentences.en: I wrote tortuous essay for obscure journals.
sentences.cn: 我给一些无名杂志写一些拐弯抹角的文章.

sentences.en: obscure legal phrases
sentences.cn: 费解的法律术语

sentences.en: The cold breeze moved through the bushes around him, whispering just loud enough to obscure the chanting.
sentences.cn: 冷飕飕的风吹动着他周边的矮树丛，沙沙声刚好盖过了吟唱的声音。

sentences.en: The contracts are written in obscure language.
sentences.cn: 那些合同是用复杂难懂的语言写的。

sentences.en: The derivation of its name is obscure.
sentences.cn: 其名字的由来鲜为人知。

sentences.en: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.cn: 他的生平不详。

sentences.en: The hymn was written by an obscure Greek composer for the 1896 Athens Olympics.
sentences.cn: 这首赞歌是希腊一位名不见经传的作曲家为1896年的雅典奥运会创作的。

sentences.en: The meaning is still obscure to me.
sentences.cn: 我对这意义还很模糊.

sentences.en: The obscure charges against him lacked specification.
sentences.cn: 对他的模糊的指控缺乏明确的说明.

sentences.en: The point of his speech is obscure.
sentences.cn: 他发言的要点模糊不清.

sentences.en: The room is too obscure for reading.
sentences.cn: 这房间太昏暗了,无法看书.

sentences.en: There are many minor and obscure poets in the age of Elizabeth.
sentences.cn: 伊丽莎白时代有许多不知名的诗人.

sentences.en: There are more obscure poems written and printed every year than clear ones.
sentences.cn: 每年创作和发表的诗篇,含蓄不露的比明朗的多.

sentences.en: These obscure groups were of little account in national politics.
sentences.cn: 这些名不见经传的团体在国内政界无足轻重。

sentences.en: This language serves to disguise and obscure.
sentences.cn: 这话是用来文过饰非的.

sentences.en: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.cn: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

sentences.en: Your ideas seem very obscure to me.
sentences.cn: 你的观点很叫我费解.

words.tran_cn: 朦胧；阴暗；晦涩；身份低微；不分明

trans.tran_cn: 暗的，不清楚的；费解的vt使阴暗,使难解
昏暗的，朦胧的，晦涩的，不清楚的，隐蔽的，不著名的，无名的
trans.tran_en: not well known and usually not very important

trans.tran_cn: 某种模糊的或不清楚的东西
使…模糊不清，掩盖；隐藏；使难理解
trans.tran_en: to make something difficult to know or understand

trans.tran_cn: 使…模糊不清，掩盖，隐藏，使难理解
trans.tran_en: If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly
